result.execSummary:
The defendant Jack H Meer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 36 days sentence credit.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court orders any items seized are forfeited and can be destroyed by the holding agency pursuant to statute.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 45 DAYS with Non-working Hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions, commencing forthwith.
BALANCE - STAYED.  To be used at Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jack H Meer

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jack H Meer in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 3 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  1.5 Years.
36 Days Credit.
STAYED.  

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation: 3 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
150 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
First 45 Days to be served at the Huber Facility.  Balance - STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  
Defendant to be transferred FORTHWITH.

Court orders any items seized are forfeited and can be destroyed by the holding agency pursuant to statute.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Court Sets Cash Bail @ $1,000
CONDITIONS REMAIN AS PREVIOUSLY FIXED.

Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.    
Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.
